list.item:
f. 20va : Purchase note.
20va: ዝሐዲሳት፡ ዘቅዱስ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ መጥምቅ፡ ዘኰኮሎ፡ ዘተሣየጦ፡ ቄስ፡ ገበዝ፡ በኵረ፡ ጽዮን፡ በንዋየ፡ ዮሐንስ።
The note states that the Ms. of the church Qǝddus Yoḥannǝs Maṭmǝq of Kwäkolo was purchased during the gabaz-tenure of priest Bäkwǝrä Ṣǝyon with the church's money. It is written in an angular script, some letters appear in a forked shape (ተ, ን, ዝ), probably in the same hand that re-wrote (partly) the ownership note on 4ra (upper margin, s. "owner").

f. 22r : Ownership note.
22r: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ጳውሎስ፡ ዘተስፋስላሴ፡ ወእሙ፡ ፍሬማርያም፡ ወብእሲቱ፡ ወለተሚካኤል፡
The note is crudely written in the upper margin. It states Tasfā Śǝllāse as an owner of the "Book of Paul" and mentions also the names of his mother Fǝre Māryām and his wife Walatta Mikāʾel. Similar notes in the same hand are written on 62vb, 78rb, 98rab, 134rb (partly erased), 151ra (partly erased). The same hand added the names of Tasfā Śǝllāse (on 29rb: Tasfā Sǝllasyä) and his wife on 30vb, 35va, 48ra. In addition, the same scribe refers to the church of Kwäkwälo (52ra, 58ra) resp. of Dabra Betel (82rb ) as the owner.

- Corrections are written over erasures: e.g., 12vb, 22va, 62ra, 64rb, 69ra, 97rb, 102rb, 104ra, 143va; or interlineally, in a secondary hand: e.g., 13rb, 87rb. - Commentaries are written in the margin or interlineally throughout Text XXIII in small script, in a secondary hand; occasionally some passages are crudely marked with lines. - Pen trial: 3v. - Writing exercises (?) on the ruled endleaves appear upside down, in different hands: 1v, 3r. - Erased notes: 3r. - Crude minor notes and scribbles, in secondary recent hands: 2r, 21rb, 151r-152v.

person.persName: The name of the original owner (Walatta <...>) has been erased from the concluding supplication of Text XXIII. The handwritten note in English "New testament Pauline" in the upper margin of 4rb (in black fountain pen) and the number 228 written upside down on 3v indicate that the book was most probably taken as booty from Mäqdäla Madḫāne ʿĀlam (founded by Tewodros II, r. 1855-68). Possibly the note ሐዲሳት፡ ዘቅዱስ፡ ዮሐንስ in the upper margin of 4ra (s. Additio 1) was written over an (partly) erased ownership note of the church Mäqdäla Madḫāne ʿĀlam. According to Additio 2, Tasfā Śǝllāse was previously (?) an owner of the Ms.
